author: Igor [VICE]
title: CardanoWall, new levels of PoE
description: Content creators or businesses need an ability to prove "Proof of Existence" authorship and avoid losing/altering the original file.

assessments.note: This project provides a good use case for the immutability of the blockchain and would drive repeated  interaction with the cardano blockchain

The facility of "Proof of Existance" as a service can result in various spin-off innovations. The proposal aims to develop a security verified system that will offer PoE as a service, a core fundamental use case of metadata; therefore, the proposal addresses the challenge comprehensively.

The proposal directly addresses the proof-of-existence and privacy aspects of the Metadata Challenge. It proposes significant new features for a rapidly maturing application that apparently is already receiving a significant level of adoption.

This proposal is a great implementation that mesh the cardano blockchain with the customer needs from any point of view. The proposal clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for the stakeholders (in detail for insurer, investors and insurance company). Furthermore there is a running solution and cloud platform just done for testing purpose...

The proposer claims to already have implemented a large amount of this project. However no evidence of this is provided. The proposer seems to have the required experience to be able to produce this project.
assessments.reply: The idea is already implemented and the link to the working website https://cardanowall.com/ was provided in the idea details

assessments.note: The proposar has published a fully functional product with the same concept. The proposal is for improving the feature including security audit and encryption support. Therefore with the proven track record it is highly likely that the proposal will be implemented successfully.

The project team has demonstrated successful development of prior capabilities that it would build on as part of the Metadata Challenge. The proposal's plan clearly distinguishes the new capabilities that would be funded and it details a realistic set of activities and a viable roadmap.

The proposer provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clear milestones and a defined time horizon, also in technical realization. The solutions is well documented and there is a running pilot platform for testing. The only thing I miss in this area is that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties in adoption processes.
The proposal is detailed in terms of the road map for future improvements. The risks associated with the proposed system are also well analyzed, and a pragmatic approach is being undertaken.

The project roadmap is specific and quantifiable enough that progress can be audited throughout the course of the project, although the fifth phase of the roadmap is somewhat vague. In general, more emphasis on measurable detail would have been helpful in the roadmap and capability description.

The proposal team is completed skilled and have a good trade of business and technical knowledge, so in my opinion will able to make surely a production platform The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work. The proposer has considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation

solution: CW lets the authors anonymously prove the authorship of PoE. It also encrypts files in a browser and stores a copy in the CW public storage.
experience: 15+ years of experience as a SW Architect and Engineer. 4+ years of deep experience working in the online data preservation/recovery field.
